definition: thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Flossing is probably skipped by the majority of men out there.
sentences.chinese: 至於牙線，更是被很多人忽視。

sentences.english: Use the thumbs and forefingers to guide the floss between the teeth.
sentences.chinese: 握緊牙線，用食指和拇指輕柔地在牙縫間操作牙線。

sentences.english: Use the thumbs and forefingers to guide the floss between the teeth.
sentences.chinese: 握緊牙線，用食指和拇指輕柔地在牙縫間操作牙線。

sentences.english: Draw the floss backwards and forwards between the teeth.
sentences.chinese: 將牙線在齒間來回拉動。

sentences.english: All of us know that we need to brush our teeth twice-a-day and floss on a regular basis.
sentences.chinese: 我們都知道應該一天刷兩次牙並有規律地用牙線潔牙。

sentences.english: Just think of all those bits of food that would be left behind if we didn’t floss.
sentences.chinese: 如果不使用牙線的話，那些食物殘渣就會留在牙縫裏。
而每天使用牙線也是必須的。

sentences.english: of us know that we need to brush our teeth twice-a-day and floss on a regular basis.
sentences.chinese: 我們都知道應該一天刷兩次牙並有規律地用牙線潔牙。

sentences.english: NO08, Did you floss your teeth?
Then they should use a thin string or dental floss to remove particles of food between the teeth.
sentences.chinese: 然後應該用小細繩或牙線清理牙齒間的食物顆粒。

sentences.english: Floss your teeth, and get a gold star on the chart!
sentences.chinese: 同樣的，每當你用牙線，就給自己獎勵一個金星。

sentences.english: Flossing your teeth is one of the best examples of the principles of time management.
sentences.chinese: 用牙線清潔牙齒是時間管理原則的最好佐證之一。

sentences.english: In addition, you should floss at least once a day.
sentences.chinese: 此外，你每天至少要用一次牙線。

sentences.english: So you might as well floss.
Those who don’t floss regularly have much higher chances of developing an oral disease, such as gingivitis.
sentences.chinese: 不經常使用牙線的人會更容易患上牙齦炎等口腔疾病。

sentences.english: Control the floss by pinching it with index fingers and thumbs like this.
sentences.chinese: 通功示指和拇指的牽推來節制牙線。

definition: to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
lit. to squeeze out toothpaste/fig. to extract a confession under pressure
to return something to its rightful owner
